result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Krystal D. Gehrke

records.addlTxt:
2:43 PM (64-06) Defendant Krystal D. Gehrke in court, in custody.  Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Krystal D. Gehrke.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
State is requesting 30 days for Arraignment Hearing.

Attorney requesting defendant to be able to appear via video next hearing. Attorney is to contact Judge Koss's clerk.

Adj. 2:47PM
Arraignment scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:06 PM (64-06) Defendant Krystal D. Gehrke not in court.  Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Krystal D. Gehrke.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Unable to contact defendant via video. (upgrade)
Attorney Solis is requesting a new Preliminary Hearing date.
Time limits are waived for the Preliminary Hearing.

State will prepare WRIT.

Adj. 2:24PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Krystal D. Gehrke in court, in custody by video from Taycheedah Correctional.  Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Krystal D. Gehrke.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
for Representation - Attorney Xavier Solis - No repayment at this time
Order for Representation - Attorney Xavier Solis
State Public Defender Attorney appointment status

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Krystal D. Gehrke in court, in custody by video from Taycheedah Corr. SPD told defendant they are trying to appoint. Court appoints attorney due to SPD conflicts. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Krystal D. Gehrke appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA James Sempf. Called @ 3:01 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance. Court addresses defendant as to appointment of new counsel. No counsel appointed yet. Court addresses Atty. Uzouwulu from SPD office as to whether he has any information on the status of appointment of counsel. Discussion. SPD needs more time to get counsel appointed. Response by the Court addresses defendant as to when she is due to be released from prison. Defendant in custody until 2023. Based on the record, Court sets matter out to give SPD time to appoint counsel and sets matter before Judge Koss as this file is assigned to him as of August 1, 2022. Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

NO CONTACT WITH ANY OF THE CO-ACTORS:  Brian N. Tidwell, Frederick M. Taylor, Thomas D. Schultz, Joshua C. Potter, Christopher F. McFadden, Sean M. Mason, Michelle A. Lyons, Jillian R. Leighton, or Kenneth W. Chadwick.Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Krystal D. Gehrke appeared by video, in custody from Taycheedah Correctional.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Krystal D. Gehrke. Called @ 3:19 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status conference on file 21CF405 and return on warrant initial appearance on file 22CF221. Record by the State who moves to dismiss file 21CF405 without prejudice as the charges in this file are now incorporated into 22CF221. No objection by Atty. Renner who asks that Atty. Selmek be allowed to withdrawal as she is leaving the office at the end of the week. Court will allow Atty. Selmek to withdraw.. Further record by Atty. Renner as to the number of co-actors in the new file that is causing conflicts for her office, and asks for 30 days to get counsel appointed on 22CF221. Court grants that request as well.
Record by the State as to bond on the 22CF file. Defendant has 18 months left on her sentence at Taycheedah. State asks for $10.000.00 signature bond with no contact with any co-actors. State to send Clerk list of names and reads them into the record. Court sets bond as requested. 22CF221 set out for adjourned initial appearance to have defendant appear with counsel. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter requesting detainer from Sheriff's Office
